wikipedia_page.main: Major-General William Augustus Fitzgerald Lane Fox-Pitt  (28 January 1896 – 26 April 1988) was a British Army officer who served in both the First World War and Second World War.

response: In October 2015, a fall at a competition in France left him in a coma for two weeks.  After regaining consciousness, he had initial trouble with blindness and then double vision, but was ultimately able to earn a spot on the British team for the 2016 Olympics and returned to international competition with the stallion Chilli Morning. He was the only remaining member of the team who won silver in London 2012.The Telegraph: William Fox-Pitt completes stunning recovery to claim Rio 2016 place
right|thumb|200px|William Fox-Pitt and Idalgo at the Hillside during the cross-country phase of Badminton Horse Trials 2009.
|+William Fox-Pitt on Idalgo clears the Cottesmore Leap at Burghley Horse Trials, 2006
